ygData.subject: Crawling HTTPS Subdomains
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, I have a problem crawling subdomains from https websites. I am using a seeds file to feed the crawler and as I only want crawl single domains my seeds file

--------------010605040605070409060201
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Hi,

I have a problem crawling subdomains from https websites.
I am using a seeds file to feed the crawler and as I only want crawl 
single domains my seeds file usually looks like this:

http://www.domain.com/
+http://(com,domain,

With a seeds file like above everything runs as expected. The crawler 
will crawl all found subdomains from domain.com.
But if I try to crawl a HTTPS Website and start with a seeds file like that:

https://www.domain.com/
+https://(com,domain,

The crawler will only crawl all pages from https://www.domain.com and 
ignore all links to subdomains like https://sub.domain.com
Did I miss some specific settings for crawling HTTPS sites or does 
anyone know why this happens?

Thanks,
Markus

--------------010605040605070409060201
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

<html>
  <head>

    <meta http-equiv="content-type" content="text/html; charset=utf-8">
  </head>
  <body style="background-color: #fff;" bgcolor="#FFFFFF" text="#000000">
    Hi,<br>
    <br>
    I have a problem crawling subdomains from https websites.<br>
    I am using a seeds file to feed the crawler and as I only want crawl
    single domains my seeds file usually looks like this:<br>
    <pre style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: normal; orphans: auto; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 1; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; word-wrap: break-word; white-space: pre-wrap;"><a class="moz-txt-link-freetext" href="http://www.domain.com/">http://www.domain.com/</a>
+http://(com,domain,</pre>
    With a seeds file like above everything runs as expected. The
    crawler will crawl all found subdomains from domain.com.<br>
    But if I try to crawl a HTTPS Website and start with a seeds file
    like that:<br>
    <meta http-equiv="content-type" content="text/html; charset=utf-8">
    <pre style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: normal; orphans: auto; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 1; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; word-wrap: break-word; white-space: pre-wrap;"><a class="moz-txt-link-freetext" href="https://www.domain.com/">https://www.domain.com/</a>
+https://(com,domain,

</pre>
    The crawler will only crawl all pages from <a class="moz-txt-link-freetext" href="https://www.domain.com">https://www.domain.com</a>
    and ignore all links to subdomains like <a class="moz-txt-link-freetext" href="https://sub.domain.com">https://sub.domain.com</a><br>
    Did I miss some specific settings for crawling HTTPS sites or does
    anyone know why this happens?<br>
    <br>
    Thanks,<br>
    Markus<br>
  </body>
</html>

--------------010605040605070409060201--
